oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Finite element analysis of fibre reinforced polymer shells using higher-order shear deformation theories on parallel distributed memory machines
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SHAH, MS
KANT, T
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: fibre reinforced composites
interlaminar stresses
higher-order sheer deformation
finite element method
parallel processing
cholesky solver
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The analysis of fibre reinforced polymer composite (FRPC) structures requires special analytical formulation. An approach based on a higher-order sheer deformation theory has been developed and used. Generally this analysis, for a real life problem, imposes great demands on computational requirements. In the present work the emphasis is on the implementation of FRP analysis software on parallel distributed-memory machine. The parallelization strategy adopted is explained and some case studies are presented. The performance with respect to number of processors is given and the effectiveness of the parallelization for solving larger problems is demonstrated.
